article:
The Tools => Execute SPARQL action allows to execute a SPARQL query on the currently selected schema.
By default you must add the prefix in your query, such as for example:
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> PREFIX test: <http://www.semanticweb.org/herve/ontologies/2023/4/untitled-ontology-11#> PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> SELECT ?individual WHERE { ?individual rdf:type test:Class5 . }
If you check the "Add Prefix in SPARQL Requests" option in the SPARQL settings, you don't nee anymore to add thez prefix, such as: By default you must add the prefix in your query, such as for example:
SELECT ?individual WHERE { ?individual rdf:type test:Class5 . }
The Tools => Execute SPARQL action allows to execute a SPARQL query on the currently selected schema:
If the query executes correctly, will have the folowing result window:
